intro: Pilea urerifolia, commonly known as the Chinese money plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its rosette of heart-shaped, glossy leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is a popular houseplant due to its ease of care and attractive foliage. Pilea urerifolia thrives in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil.
